fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Enlargement, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, External Relations, Digital economy and society, Communication, Migration and asylum
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
goals__remit: Carnegie Europe is the European office of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace, one of the oldest foreign and security policy think-tanks in the world. The Carnegie Endowment maintains a long tradition of non- partisanship. From its Brussels platform, Carnegie Europe focuses on European foreign policy in particular topics ranging from Turkey to the Middle East and the Eastern neighborhood to security and defense. Carnegie Europe works to advance the cause of peace through analysis and development of fresh policy ideas and direct engagement and collaboration with decisionmakers in government, business, and civil society.
relevant_communication:
Research: Carnegie Europe’s team of scholars throughout the European continent produces a wide range of publications and provides analysis and policy recommendations on the strategic foreign and security policy issues facing the European Union and its member states. 
 
Events and Outreach: Carnegie Europe also organizes regular public and private events in Europe and in Brussels in particular bringing together thought leaders, academics, and policy makers to discuss strategic and recent global and regional developments of relevance to Europe.
